dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Observed from estuaries and river deltas over sand and mud bottoms.  Feeds by filtering the substrate or by selectively catching prey.  Collected in large numbers during reproduction in shallow flowing water (Ref. 26240).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Río Atrato, Colombia, to Belém, Brazil near the mouth of the Amazon River, all Atlantic slope drainages.
dataObjects.references: Watson, R.E. and H. Horsthemke 1995 Revision of Euctenogobius, a monotypic subgenus of Awaous, with discussion of its natural history (Teleostei: Gobiidae). Rev. Fr. Aquariol. 22(3-4):83-92. (Ref. 26240)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Awaous flavus
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Awaous flavus." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 29 Jul 2013, 03:05 UTC. 25 Jan 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Awaous_flavus&oldid=587549887>.
dataObjects.description:
Awaous flavus is a species of goby native to fresh and brackish waters of rivers and estuaries of South America from Colombia to near the mouth of the Amazon River in Brazil. Males of this species can reach a length of 8.2 centimetres (3.2 in) SL while females only reach 7.6 centimetres (3.0 in) SL.[1]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2013). "Awaous flavus" in FishBase. April 2013 version.

Life stage: unsexed
Note:
Location: Guyana, Waini River.
